etymology.description: 重(重) (zhòng, "heavy; weighty") and 要(要) (yào, "want; essential") combine to express the concept of importance. The weightiness associated with 重(重) (zhòng, "heavy") suggests significance, while 要(要) (yào, "essential") indicates necessity or importance.
etymology.interpretation: The word 重要(重要) (zhòngyào, "important") highlights the concept of something being weighty in significance, underscoring its essential nature.

examples.chinese: 诚信是重要的(誠信是重要的)。
学习很重要(學習很重要)，努力同样重要(努力同樣重要)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxí hěn zhòng yào, nǔlì tóngyàng zhòng yào.
examples.english: Studying is important, and working hard is equally important.

examples.chinese: 家庭是重要的(家庭是重要的)，朋友亦然(朋友亦然)。
examples.pinyin: Jiātíng shì zhòng yào de, péngyǒu yìrán.
examples.english: Family is important, and so are friends.
